dct_title_s: Topographical sketch of the Gold and Quicksilver District of California
dct_description_sm: E.O.C. O. Lt. U.S.A. ; P.S. Duval's Lith steam Press Phila.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
Bar scale on map given in "geographical Miles."
Shows topography, vegetation, drainage, routes, etc.
Descriptive text, e.g.: Gold found on these streams.

From a map set including: Positions of the Upper and Lower gold Mines on the South Fork of the American River, California. July 20, 1848 -- Upper Mines.Nos. 1 & 8, [and on same sheet] Lower Mines or Mormon Diggings. No. 3.
Appears in Polks' Message to Congress: U.S. Congress. House. Exec. doc. no. 1, 30th Cong., 2nd Sess., December 5, 1848 (Serial 537).
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Warren Heckrotte Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain.  There are no restrictions on use.  If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
